name: California 2

reviews.title: There's Nothing Like Hotel California
reviews.text: I loved this place. It's got so much character! Right on the river, within walking distance to the Royal Palace and Historical Museum, near all the shops. You definitely won't be bored easily. If you want to see the city, you can sit at the downstairs bar, have a Tiger beer, and watch all the locals and expats coming in and out of this place. Jim and Steve are fantastic. Steve gave us information on diving in Kampong Saom, and arranged Mekong boat tickets for our transport into Vietnam. The food at the restaurant is great. I tried a local dish and the fish tacos and both were excellent. I woke up in the morning, went out on the balcony and saw an ELEPHANT going for a morning stroll with its owner. Totally a different world.
What a great location, just across the road from the river. This is a very narrow hotel so only 2 room get a river view, the rest look out onto the wall of the building next door.
reviews.title: Book one of the two riverview rooms or avoid this place.

likes.disliked: — Sex tourist, dirty rooms, lumpy beds.

reviews.text: Some people seem to love this place others loath it, there is a strong sex tourist feel here and those of a more sensitive disposition might find the conversations overheard a little off putting.
reviews.title: Bloody great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are average and a little run down, everything seems to work OK and the staff are friendly enough. However apart from the two river rooms there are a lot better value places in P.P to stay in.
reviews.title: If your country supported Pol Pot stay here.

likes.liked: — Proximity to sights and good restaurants, River views from 2 rooms, Generator supplying 24 Hr power.

reviews.text: At 20-25 dollars I really expected more, breakfast was included and was the usual eggs, toast coffee deal. It was much like the hotel itself, OK but not memorable.
reviews.title: recommended

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, clean rooms, great location.

reviews.text: right when you think you find a good deal,something great comes along. The Hotel California 2 is that place. it's the best value that i found on a long asia trip.
reviews.title: best value in town
Ask for the river view room at the California 2
reviews.text: this little gem on the river is close to everything in town,just around the corner from the royal palace.heck, it seems to be just around the corner from everything.

reviews.title: Asia Traveler
reviews.text: it's a small guesthouse with plenty of big hotel qualities.

I Stayed at the hotel in early January 2008.The hotel is run by an American named Jim who is a gentleman and a wealth of information on Cambodia.The hotel is located in the centre of the riverfront,a perfect location.That said the hotel rooms are very old and need serious upgrading.I stayed in the river view room,top floor,and the room was like something out the 1970,s.I also had no running water at the sink.The hotel itself is frequented by middle aged American gentlemen who sit in the foyer,and outside the hotel,all day and night long.Why....?I travelled all round Cambodia on my trip and this was the least value for money hotel i stayed in,there is certainly a lot better in Phnom Penh for what they charge....
reviews.title: VERY AVERAGE,DATED ROOMS...

reviews.text: I came by last August. It's right on the river in the middle of all the action. They have their own driver waiting to take you anywhere you want to go. California 2 made me feel very safe and comfortable at a time when I needed just that. First of all, their staff are so friendly you won't want to leave. Second, the food at the bar is excellent and deliciously unique! Third, the rooms are really nice and have aircon and tv, among other things (like hot water showers). If you're interested in meeting both travellers or expatriates in Cambodia, or even if you feel like just being alone but not feeling alone, California 2 is the place to stay. Very affordable and friendly beyond description.
reviews.title: California 2 is an Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner (Jim) and his manager were sincerely happy to meet me. That meant so much. They actually cared about the people staying in their place. These guys sent me on my way with a t-shirt for my girl (it looks very sexy on her) and they gave me a couple postcards. They pretty much planned my day for me too the next day. Very helpful and knowledgable, but most of all: sincere and honest. That counts for so much in a place like Cambodia where you can run across a brothel or a scam at any corner. You won't regret staying with these guys.
reviews.title: How your holiday should be!

reviews.text: I was very impressed by this hotel, and I'll be coming back for sure. The staff were especially friendly. Long live fish tacos and inexpensive malts. I have come to Cambodia twice now and each time I walk away feeling like I've missed out on something. Next time I'm hoping to get a place with with California 2 for a couple days to get their personal suggestions, and to finally do it the right way. Their menus even have travel suggestions for people who want to travel and see things that might be off the beaten path. So while you're looking for what to eat (or waiting for your slow partner), you can see what tomorrow might bring if you're undecided on what to do or where to go.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, perfect location on the river

likes.disliked: — No comment - I've stayed for one night and did enjoy just everything.

reviews.text: I'd send my own mother to this place, but I'd send my own buddy too. That's the kind of service you can expect from these guys. If you ever find yourself in Phenom Penh, please drop me them a line. You won't regret it. This is the email they gave me: [--]
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: Traveling to Phnom Penh for the first time in a small group of five, we had different expectations, concerns, and objectives. One thing we all agreed upon though was that we wanted to stay in a safe location, central to the sights, comfortable, friendly, and hopefully, unique. We found all of that, and even more than we expected, at California 2.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Find

likes.liked: — the people made the experience memorable

reviews.text: What made this guesthouse so memorable? The fact that you never felt like you were a guest in someone else's house. We were treated like old friends, like family, like long lost cousins with whom everyone there was so anxious to catch up with.
reviews.title: It should be called Arizoona 1

reviews.text: Jim, the proprietor, a California native, has brought charm and warmth to the place. As is already well-known, they offer incredible food at very reasonable prices, and coming from California myself, I can attest to the fact that the fish tacos are second to none.
reviews.title: Don't believe the hype

reviews.text: Beyond that, the staff goes the distance and beyond. We needed to contact a travel agent we'd booked the rest of our trip with, and after several calls throughout the mid-morning, there was no answer at the travel agency. The lovely staff called and called for us on their own phones until thay made contact, alleviating much anxiety as we arrived in this new city with unticketed plans to leave two days later. It is that type of camaraderie that one does not find just anywhere, an easy helpfulness that goes well beyond one's job duties.
reviews.title: A Big Disappointment
I found a new home...
reviews.text: I've read criticisms that the rooms are ordinary or the prices are not in line with Vietnam. I guess it is easy to be critical of anything if that is your focus. We were five very different people with different styles, wants and needs, and a month later, we are all still talking about how welcome, how comfortable, and how wonderful we were taken care of at California 2.

description: Located in the Wat Phnom Area, on the riverfront, California 2 has easy access to the Port and is 3 doors away from the Mekong Express bus terminal. Plenty of country information as well.
